ActorTalk: There you are, Commandant.
I recently learned a new folding technique that makes the clovers more three-dimensional. When you use glossy paper, they sparkle in the sunlight. It's really pretty.
But the technique is pretty tricky, and I haven't quite mastered it yet. I was practicing just now during my free time.
I've tried many times, but no matter how careful I was, something always felt off. But this one came out perfectly. It's the most beautiful clover I've ever folded.
Which means... maybe the clover's already brought a little luck, just by turning out the way it did.
It's for you, Commandant. I hope it brings you good luck.
(Looking closely, you find this origami clover almost identical to the one in the lounge.)
By the way, Commandant, what was that movie you mentioned earlier?
You heard it from me...? But until just now, I hadn't heard anything about a Froggie movie.
If what you're saying is true, there should be a record in the terminal. I checked our communication logs. Nothing came up.
Maybe the recent mission overload has been affecting your rest, Commandant...?
Either way, since we've finally got some time off, you should take this chance to relax and recharge, Commandant.
Why not start now? I'm curious about that Froggie movie you mentioned. Would you go with me?
(It looks just like the one in the lounge...)
It's beautifully folded.
I can tell you put a lot of care into it.
(Explain the event and movie details to Lucia)
Same here.
I might've just gotten things mixed up. Been busy lately.
It's not that bad.
Sure. Let's go.
